author: Special Correspondent
text:
Students in Standards IV to IX can send preliminary entries for the Young World Painting Contest organised in association with Thyrocare.

Students should choose any of the topics given below an paint on a white drawing sheet (size 26 cm X 27cm).

The entries should be certified by either the principal or art teacher. The name, Standard, school, residential address, mobile number, and e-mail id should be written on the backside of the drawing sheet.

Topics

Topics for juniors (Standards IV to VI): at the toy/pet store, gully cricket, Sunday family picnic, cleaning my street, a day at the zoo, at the circus, water birds, scenes from a village, first visit to the public library, and summer activities.

Topics for seniors (Standards VII to IX): beach clean-up, camping out, New Year carnival, classical/rock music concert, book fair, underwater life, portraits of emotions, if dinosaurs existed today, domesticating the wild, retelling your favourite fairy tale and life without technology.

Those selected will be intimated through e-mail.

They should reach the venue (with the intimation letter) at their own cost on the specified date to participate in the finals. Topics for the finals will be given at the venue.

Prizes for winners will be distributed in the afternoon. All finalists will receive certificates.

Last date for receipt of entries is March 6.

For registration and other details, log on to:www.thehindu.com/ ywpaintingwhere they can get their Unique ID, which should be mentioned on the top of the drawing. Entries should be sent to The Hindu , Circulation Department, 19 &20 ATT Colony, LIC Road, Coimbatore -641018.

Contact R. Amarnath on 90039 13286.
title: Entries invited for painting contest
